CA20B845B7A5486ABEBB7D093E593AC5.description: Consider and reflect upon pre-set goals.

5544B1652D164825B85694A3D602CE1C.description: Seek feedback from peers, teacher, and others

BE38129409C84C14B91BCED3800BD7AC.description: Co-reflect on viewing, listening, reading, speaking, writing, and other forms of representing to identify strengths and to discuss attributes of, and strategies used by, good viewers, listeners, readers, representers, speakers, and writers.

577EDCC3B0DE4B73A3C88A2EDA8FDB4C.description: Reflect on viewing, listening, reading, speaking, writing, and other representing experiences in the context of teacher-led discussions.

08756C198B1B40D1820F94171D2BB329.description: Set and monitor, in consultation with the teacher, goals for more effective viewing, listening, reading, representing, speaking, and writing experiences.

77C65BC622D14620BEC70D9BB015F7F6.description: Consider and reflect upon pre-set goals.

36C1CEE3787B4C139EF433E8F556CB7E.description: Seek feedback from peers, teacher, and others

808B89C1F1E74C0FA4CA59A373703271.description: Co-reflect on viewing, listening, reading, speaking, writing, and other forms of representing to identify strengths and to discuss attributes of, and strategies used by, good viewers, listeners, readers, representers, speakers, and writers.

8D538486EC504300BC587D07264DFBCF.description: Reflect on viewing, listening, reading, speaking, writing, and other representing experiences in the context of teacher-led discussions.

2674A6C5CADA4C19B4BBCA7592F84288.description: Identify, with teacher guidance, what good viewers, listeners, readers, representers, speakers, and writers do.

6F54ABCC075B4BD4AFB94C47E8AF8490.description: Assess and Reflect (AR). Students will develop their abilities to assess and reflect on their own language skills, discuss the skills of effective viewers, listeners, readers, representers, speakers, and writers, and set goals for future improvement.

0E89A8C1CF464B8CA6E25795F85D9540.description: Share work with others for feedback.

826E3BED6D444C90853A396F1094B39A.description: Write a complete sentence with six words or more using capitals, correct spacing, and some punctuation.

B58B0DCD4E1F46479D2706134E2A991F.description: Attempt to choose interesting words in independent writing

FDF2DEE81BEF4C2AACAE6B3BD448A4F0.description: Begin to include related details with main idea and edit with teacher support.

E69C496FB8234BD18B36EA353537D6C5.description: Write brief explanations and descriptions (accompanied by pictures) of real objects, persons, and places

03055FA356AF4E90902E3B01E397C3E2.description: Create short texts including informational texts, autobiographical narratives, imaginative stories, and poems with own ideas following a model.

CE324E8E326545DC915F9B1AD581BA31.description: Write about familiar topics using the learned vocabulary to express ideas.

7D7C911CE1BA4CB1A511032150A1DC01.description: Use applicable pragmatic, textual, syntactic, semantic/lexical/ morphological, graphophonic, and other communication cues and conventions to construct and communicate meaning when writing.

89A908E3C39A45AA8F4BFC54B031E076.description: Select and use the appropriate before, during, and after strategies when writing to communicate meaning.

6B2AF226FF84436B9E6B409B59E661ED.description: Recognize that writing is a process focused upon conveying meaning to self and others.

8773C2A7828545D8910423A989DCFC88.description: Write and share stories and short informational texts about familiar events and experiences in a minimum of five sentences.

45E8200FFCB9430686B847196A315843.description: Rehearse and deliver brief short poems, rhymes, songs, stories (including contemporary and traditional First Nations, Métis, and Inuit poems and stories) or lines from a play and oral presentations about familiar experiences or interests.

C57EAE24938349DAAAF47C5579271EBF.description: Relate an important event or personal experience in a simple sequence

6B5C76501BCD422B84957119E3313264.description: Retell stories using a beginning, middle, and end, and include details regarding who, what, when, where, why, and how.

BE4ACD6083074D00BA4F1DEDABC8168A.description: Give directions that include several sequenced steps.

BD7CFB9E92CC40F584A1FF0B807E24AD.description: Share and talk about what is being learned, and stay on topic when speaking.

DBDE839B7B034BE081C2074E48F5C220.description: Use applicable pragmatic, textual, syntactic, semantic/lexical/ morphological, graphophonic, and other communication cues and conventions to construct and communicate meaning when speaking

41C3AE440045485C94340D19724E6336.description: Select and use the appropriate before, during, and after strategies when speaking to communicate meaning

0CC2EB487BBB43D9947881F0BB13F103.description: Use oral language to bring meaning to what is listened to, observed, felt, viewed, and read.

6C45B49E192942F3A0E9DE8081070418.description: Speak clearly and audibly about ideas, experiences, preferences, questions, and conclusions in a logical sequence, using expression and dramatization when appropriate.

33F3B62C04D740AFB0336D3BB1570265.description: Explore electronic technology to represent ideas and events.

2F2C6CB8453C43DBAA5003BB55D69B5D.description: Dramatize a story (e.g., a traditional First Nations, Métis, or Inuit story).

5BCB5E144BA742358706CC34042F7E76.description: Use applicable pragmatic, textual, syntactic, semantic/lexical/ morphological, graphophonic, and other communication cues and conventions to construct and communicate meaning when using various forms of representing.

81F8584ADE3342CCADD2F7E7F34DF2A2.description: Select and use the appropriate before, during, and after strategies when using various forms of representing to communicate meaning.

07B78032FAED483A8E010CB1E75EAB6E.description: Understand that making pictures, illustrations, and other representations clarify and extend understanding.

DF1C0F357A4947E28AA218A25288A8DB.description: Represent key ideas and events, in a logical sequence and with detail, in different ways (including dramatization, pictures, sounds, physical movement, charts, models, and drawings).

33C7B5CDD799476E99D8185235DB78DA.description: Use inquiry to explore a question or topic of interest related to the themes and topics being studied: Discuss personal knowledge and understanding of a topic to discover research interests and needs., Use the language of inquiry (e.g., “I want to find out if ...”, “I know ...”). • Ask questions to satisfy personal curiosity on a topic and discuss information needs., Ask and answer questions to help satisfy group curiosity and information needs on a specific topic. Answer questions using visual, multimedia, oral, and print sources., Understand that resource centre materials have a specific organization system and use titles to locate information and ideas, Recognize when information answers the questions asked, Collect and organize relevant ideas and information, Represent and tell key ideas and facts in own words, and Share with peers and teacher what was learned through inquiry.

A7BD5EB530284238B80AB0D943BC4636.description: Create stories and short informational texts of several sentences to communicate ideas and information about self, others, and the natural and constructed environments.

B976D2BF43664A36B8E018B7AA822DC0.description: Create stories, explanations, poems, and dramatizations using known patterns and later developing own patterns.

D0E9D9283213412E9AA6C5BBEB46BD80.description: Dictate to another person and compose stories that tell personal feelings, ideas, experiences, opinions, observations, and reactions.

FBFDF0163E64484E81A77F8349C90855.description: Use words, symbols, and other forms, including appropriate technology, to express understanding of topics, themes, and issues related to identity, community, and social responsibility

1E99D4F30D854866AA8DDAD1F56BCF8E.description: Compose and create a range of visual, multimedia, oral, and written texts that explore and present thoughts on: identity (e.g., Feelings),  community (e.g., Neighbourhood) and social responsibility (e.g., Plants and Trees).

103C133B2188407291BCD7699631D41E.description: Compose and Create (CC). Students will develop their abilities to speak, write, and use other forms of representation to explore and present thoughts, feelings, and experiences in a variety of forms for a variety of purposes and audiences

AAFBBEE0D7ED4BEA95E87A2BC4CCCC75.description: Read and re-read “just-right” texts independently for a sustained minimum 10-15 minute period daily for enjoyment and to improve fluency (30-60 wcpm orally) and comprehension.

DCC52010F56749A588733A994426B839.description: Retell the central ideas of simple expository and narrative passages (including contemporary and traditional First Nations and Métis stories), identify and describe where and when stories take place, the characters in a story (and their feelings), and the story’s beginning, middle, and end, as well as the problem and the solution.

0770FE2DB7ED490CB6796C60DAC3C96A.description: Read and follow one-step, two-step, and three-step written instructions.

462BBC536141454AB6950DC46B1359CA.description: Identify the sequence of an informational text and respond to who, what, when, where, why, and how questions.

12C9B785AA1A432784A9783902C6FCEF.description: Read aloud with fluency, expression, and comprehension any text that is already familiar and is at an independent reading level.

A4DEF8EAAF814CDA8A96C8D71D41835E.description: Use applicable pragmatic, textual, syntactic, semantic/lexical/ morphological, graphophonic, and other communication cues and conventions to construct and communicate meaning when reading.

BB6E8F8BF651414ABE687A095D76D184.description: Select and use the appropriate before, during, and after strategies when reading.

25800DAE4BB04A4880B86D175267A35B.description: Read and interpret own writing, experience charts, labels, symbols, and print in environment.

1A6FD74DD81243F7B657DD75126804B6.description: Read and comprehend grade-appropriate texts (including narratives, informational texts, scripts, and poems) by relating the sequence (i.e., beginning, middle, and end), the key points (who, what, when, where, and why), and the problems and solutions.

ECAE6B254B1D4FB99F4DEE27C3DD4B45.description: Listen to carry out directions with four to six simple steps.

9100482EC64E4E9D898ACDE9492F020A.description: Demonstrate attentiveness and comprehension as a listener through body language and facial expressions (e.g., nodding in agreement).

1163F50A0BAA4FBC9A1DA323DD931800.description: Listen courteously and attentively to understand the meaning and intent of others.

2875D483C5DA46D7B5623A2E20317E0B.description: Listen to texts and retell the most important information (e.g., who, what, when, where, why, and how).

E98ED596321D43968AD8C2319E6B2254.description: Retell stories (including oral traditions shared by Elders and Knowledge Keepers) by relating the sequence of story events by answering who, what, when, where, why, and how questions.

E1247409DFE442048C9C22057B8EC4A2.description: Use applicable pragmatic, textual, syntactic, semantic/lexical/ morphological, graphophonic, and other communication cues and conventions to construct and communicate meaning when listening

444D9457E6474A8A92F0EBD987658B87.description: Select and use the appropriate before, during, and after strategies when listening.

0364450B6ADC439E812B8F0B8B61B89F.description: Listen and respond appropriately to a range of oral communications including selected works of children’s literature and traditional and contemporary First Nations and Métis stories.

E9978DE53C3441D086BFE96353D77B7F.description: Listen to and comprehend a variety of texts (including a book read aloud, a person speaking, and directions) to retell the sequence and key points (who, what, when, where, why, and how).

23A42475F93246C1AFAFDC1CC8CA9F99.description: View and demonstrate understanding that visual texts are sources of information including ideas and information about First Nations, Métis, Inuit peoples, and other cultures.

B497E672F8A64CF8B30DC9811DA714DF.description: Recognize feelings portrayed in visual and multimedia texts, including pictures, photographs, diagrams, pictographs, and icons.

B4384818D8EF469693D075F7AE7EAEA8.description: Distinguish between daily life and life depicted in television shows, cartoons, and films.

D0BB4C7FA8384A89858047A5A460DB3A.description: View a video version of a print book and discuss how the two versions are the same and different.

9B4EA945DC4543B2854F31E9E9D85F0D.description: Recognize the commonalities in works by the same illustrator.

C4BAB133EDA949088960589F7294D67B.description: Use applicable pragmatic, textual, syntactic, semantic/lexical/ morphological, graphophonic, and other communication cues and conventions to construct and communicate meaning when viewing.

080AD6F7B22B401EAFC08AB677A535FA.description: Select and use the appropriate before, during, and after strategies when viewing.

41BB46B574B64C1DB78936C8328938C9.description: Identify and locate the key information in pictures, charts, and other visual forms (e.g., photographs, physical movement, icons) including traditional and contemporary First Nations and Métis resources and performances.

99677BAD22634C6A9E300495C02C5D6E.description: View and comprehend the explicit messages, feelings, and features in a variety of visual and multimedia texts (including pictures, photographs, simple graphs, diagrams, pictographs, icons, and illustrations).

E596CB8524394EF2AF4AC3D3ACF26869.description: Show respect for own culture and the various cultures, lifestyles, and experiences represented in texts including First Nations and Métis cultures.

A275F5B6285841B4AC7CB2B8214D53DC.description: Describe characters, the way they might feel, and the way situations might cause them to feel.

CE2D06190787474CB20DF7E16BB589B7.description: Show awareness of the experiences and ideas of other persons encountered through texts.

3311EE39489C4F6F8B19D18645A19498.description: Relate aspects of stories and characters from various texts to personal feelings and experiences.

F1B6436409DB489884B9EF96E5E2D70A.description: Make and share connections among texts, prior knowledge, and personal experiences (e.g., family traditions).

B1AB5B5505CF4989A01F362D019402AD.description: View, listen to, read, and respond to a variety of texts including First Nations and Métis resources that present different viewpoints and perspectives on issues related to identity, community, and social responsibility.

BA2B7607D97545AEA1C7C1F19329B4D0.description: Comprehend and respond to a variety of grade-level texts (including contemporary and traditional visual, oral, written, and multimedia) that address: identity (e.g., All About Me), community (e.g., Friends and Family) and social responsibility (e.g., Conservation) and relate to own feelings, ideas, and experiences.

CE3B734E133A4203AF5D87B395BA9CEA.description: Comprehend and Respond (CR) - Students will develop their abilities to view, listen to, read, comprehend, and respond to a variety of contemporary and traditional grade-level-appropriate texts in a variety of forms (oral, print, and other media) from First Nations, Métis, and other cultures for a variety of purposes including for learning, interest, and enjoyment.
